intro: Phellandrium mathioli, commonly known as the pink myrtle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, fragrant scent when crushed. Phellandrium mathioli is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
